blocks.text: In these next three sessions we are going to lean into the second core value of “BLESS” and how our identity in Christ flows into a deep, missional love for the world. “Loving our neighbors” in our mission statement is all about our horizontal relationships with people. We are going to discover God’s purpose for His satisfied children to bless the world through our roles in our families and in our spheres of influence.

items: Loving God → We desire to BE God’s satisfied children, love Him, and glorify Him.
And our neighbors → We desire to BLESS others where we live, work, and play.
Together → We BELONG to a welcoming spiritual family.

blocks.text: As we are overwhelmed by God’s great missional love for us through Jesus, we begin to understand that He invites us into that same mission. Blessing others starts right at home and overflows into the neighborhood and workplace. May we live generously and missionally because God first sent His Son to bless us with salvation.

blocks.text: Understanding the Bible

The Parable of the Good Samaritan - “Which of these three, do you think, proved to be a neighbor to the man who fell among the robbers?” He said, “The one who showed him mercy.” And Jesus said to him, “Go, and do likewise.”

And let us not grow weary of doing good, for in due season we will reap, if we do not give up. So then, as we have opportunity, let us do good to everyone, and especially to those who are of the household of faith.

blocks.text: Summary Teaching

Blessing our neighbors is not a program - it’s a lifestyle of noticing, caring, and showing the love of Jesus in ordinary, everyday ways. It starts with simple acts: a smile, a meal, a listening ear, helping with a project, praying for them by name.

When we bless others where we live, work, and play, we are living out the Great Commandment and the Great Commission right where God has placed us. Our neighborhoods become the harvest field, and we get to be the hands and feet of Jesus.
